Table of Contents

Interface INotificationService

Namespace
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.Services
Assembly
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll

Service interface for notification management and delivery. Provides comprehensive notification handling with support for different notification types, priority levels, and user action tracking.

public interface INotificationService

Remarks

This service centralizes all notification-related functionality including:

  • Notification creation and delivery based on article events and rules
  • User action tracking (click, dismiss) for notification analytics
  • Notification history and pending notification management
  • Duplicate notification prevention through intelligent checks
  • Notification cleanup based on retention policy

All methods return DTOs instead of entities to maintain separation of concerns. Implementations must ensure:

  • All operations support cancellation via CancellationToken
  • Notifications are stored durably and survive application restarts
  • Event-driven architecture allows UI to react to new notifications in real-time
  • Proper logging for audit and debugging purposes

Methods

CleanupOldNotificationsAsync(int, CancellationToken)

Cleans up old notifications based on retention policy.

Task<int> CleanupOldNotificationsAsync(int retentionDays = 30, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

retentionDays int

Number of days to keep notifications. Default: 30.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<int>

The number of notifications deleted.

Exceptions

ArgumentException

Thrown if retentionDays is less than 1.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.

GetArticleNotificationHistoryAsync(int, CancellationToken)

Retrieves all notifications for a specific article.

Task<List<NotificationDto>> GetArticleNotificationHistoryAsync(int articleId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

articleId int

The ID of the article.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<List<NotificationDto>>

A list of notification DTOs for the specified article.

Exceptions

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

Thrown if articleId is less than or equal to 0.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.

RecordNotificationActionAsync(UpdateNotificationActionDto, CancellationToken)

Records a user action performed on a notification.

Task<bool> RecordNotificationActionAsync(UpdateNotificationActionDto actionDto, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

actionDto UpdateNotificationActionDto

The DTO containing action information.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<bool>

True if the action was successfully recorded; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This method updates the notification with action timestamp and type for analytics.

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Thrown if actionDto is null.

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

Thrown if notification ID is invalid.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.

SendNotificationAsync(CreateNotificationDto, CancellationToken)

Sends a notification for an article, optionally triggered by a specific rule.

Task<NotificationDto?> SendNotificationAsync(CreateNotificationDto createDto, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

createDto CreateNotificationDto

The DTO containing notification creation data.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<NotificationDto>

The created notification DTO if successful; otherwise, null.

Remarks

This method performs the following steps:

  • Checks for duplicate notifications using ShouldNotifyAsync(int, int?, CancellationToken)
  • Creates a notification record in the database
  • Raises the OnNotificationCreated event for UI consumption

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Thrown if createDto is null.

ArgumentException

Thrown if article ID is invalid.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.

ShouldNotifyAsync(int, int?, CancellationToken)

Determines whether a notification should be sent for the specified article.

Task<bool> ShouldNotifyAsync(int articleId, int? ruleId = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

articleId int

The ID of the article.

ruleId int?

Optional rule ID to check specific rule conditions.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<bool>

True if a notification should be sent; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This method checks if a notification for this article was already sent recently to prevent duplicate notifications.

Exceptions

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

Thrown if articleId is less than or equal to 0.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.

Events

OnNotificationCreated

Event raised when a new notification is created.

event EventHandler<NotificationDto>? OnNotificationCreated

Event Type

EventHandler<NotificationDto>

Remarks

UI components should subscribe to this event to display toast notifications and update notification badges/counters in real-time. Event arguments contain the notification DTO with all relevant information.
